title: Rugby World Cup: Eddie Jones says 'Typhoon Gods' smiling on England after France game is called off
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

England head coach Eddie Jones struggled to hide his glee following the cancellation of England’s final group game at the Rugby World Cup against France.

Typhoon Hagibis, which is due to hit Tokyo on Saturday, has caused chaos with the competition’s schedule.

Italy’s chances of qualifying for the knockout phase have been ruined following the decision to call off their match against New Zealand, while Scotland’s fate hangs in the balance with a decision pending over their game against hosts Japan, which could yet be played behind closed doors on Sunday.

Advertisement

Advertisement

England cemented their place in the last eight of the tournament following victory over Argentina last weekend and are now almost certain to meet Australia in the quarter finals, but the adverse weather conditions have handed Jones’ side an unlikely boost in the shape of an unscheduled two-week break.

‘We’ve got a fairly exceptional record in two-week preparations,’ said Jones when asked if so much time off could prove to be a disadvantage.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

‘I think we’re batting at about 95%, so we’ve got to find 5% from somewhere,’

‘Our players have got the opportunity now to build the tank up and then empty it on Saturday week against whoever we’re playing, so that’s a fantastic opportunity for us.

‘We’re not concerned at all. We’ve absolutely excited.

‘Who would think we would have two relatively easy games, one tougher one and then have two weeks to prepare for a quarter-final?

‘So someone is smiling on us – the typhoon gods maybe?’

MORE: Rugby World Cup: England vs France off because of Typhoon Hagibis with Scotland vs Japan in doubt

MORE: What happens if England’s Rugby World Cup clash with France is called off?
